column1: title_event_francia_name_change.desc0:"The reign of the Karling dynasty has come to an end!\n\nThe [francia_title.GetName] has finally slipped from their grasp. With the Karlings removed
column2: these lands are truly no longer a part of their old empire.\n\nWith me as the future [ROOT.Char.GetTitleAsNameNoTooltip]
column3: we have a new and bright destiny ahead of us. It is
column5: only fitting to remove #EMP any and all#! reminders of their influence. Including the very #EMP name#! itself!"

column2: and the throne of old [asturias.GetBaseNameNoTier] vacant
column3: the Kingdom of Pelagius has finally been outgrown. Its rump shall forever be known as [leon.GetBaseNameNoTier]
column4: at least till that too is eclipsed by the rise of [castille.GetBaseNameNoTierNoTooltip]."

column1: title_event.0013.desc0:"Now that I hold the thrones of both [asturias.GetBaseNameNoTier] and a distinct [castille.GetBaseNameNoTier]
column2: the idea of a unified [asturias.GetNameNoTooltip] is considered both a little confusing and somewhat redundant by many.\n\nInstead
column3: nobles and commoners alike have begun referring to the westerly half of my lands by alluding to the dominant inland portion

column1: title_event.0013.a0:"Two crowns are better than one!"
title_event.0014.desc0:"The recent formation of an independent [castille.GetBaseName]
column3: has shattered my realm's claim to be the [asturias.GetBaseName].\n\nWith our eastern lands firmly lost to us
column4: we are dominated by the inland area of [leon.GetBaseNameNoTier]
column5: and folk of every class and sect are letting the old title fall by the wayside."

column1: title_event.0014.b0:"We'll get those lands back some day..."
title_event.0014.c0:"Huzzah! A whole #EMP kingdom#! of comrades!"
title_event.0015.desc0:"With the recent creation of the [castille.GetBaseName]
column3: castille_char)] can no longer be said to truly rule a united [asturias.GetBaseNameNoTier].\n\nWithout the balancing force of my lands in the east
column4: the former-[asturias.GetBaseNameNoTierNoTooltip] is really little more than a [leon.GetBaseName]. Peasantry
column6: and even nobles alike have all begun referring to it as such

column1: title_event.0015.a0:"Power is back where it should always have been."
